body: The largest open Bengali speech corpus is now available on OpenSLR. We cover the data collection process, speaker demographics, transcription pipeline, and baseline ASR results that accompany the release.
excerpt: The largest open Bengali speech corpus is now available on OpenSLR.
title: BākoSpeech: Open-Sourcing 10,200 Hours of Bengali Audio

body: On International Mother Language Day, Dr. Rahman reflects on what it means that the language martyrs died for in 1952 still lacks a functional keyboard standard, official Unicode support for all scripts, and AI that speaks it well.
excerpt: On International Mother Language Day, Dr. Rahman reflects on the digital status of the Bengali language.
title: 21st February and the Unfinished Work of Language Recognition

body: After two years of crawling, cleaning, and de-duplicating, we are releasing BākoCorpus 2.0 — the largest open Bengali text corpus ever published. In this post, we walk through the data pipeline, discuss quality filtering decisions, and explain what this means for Bengali NLP research.
excerpt: The largest open Bengali text corpus ever published. In this post, we walk through the data pipeline and quality filtering decisions.
title: BākoCorpus 2.0 Is Here: 5 Billion Tokens of Open Bengali Text

body: Results from our landmark 12-week study with British-Bangladeshi heritage learners aged 8–16. The data is encouraging — but so are the surprises. Fahmida Islam shares what she did not expect to find.
excerpt: Results from our landmark 12-week study with British-Bangladeshi heritage learners aged 8–16.
title: BākoLearn in UK Schools: What 240 Heritage Learners Taught Us

body: How we constructed a 52,000-sentence parallel corpus for one of the world's most challenging language pairs — and what it reveals about the limits of transfer learning from large multilingual models.
excerpt: How we constructed a 52,000-sentence parallel corpus for one of the world's most challenging language pairs.
title: Bengali↔Tibetan MT: Building a Bridge Between Two Ancient Languages

body: We are delighted to announce a Mozilla Technology Fund grant to build BākoLM — a fully open Bengali language model trained from scratch. Here is what we plan to build and our timeline.
excerpt: We are delighted to announce a Mozilla Technology Fund grant to build BākoLM — a fully open Bengali language model.
title: Bāk Receives Mozilla Technology Fund Grant for Open Bengali AI

body: A frank look at benchmark scores for frontier models on Bengali tasks. Spoiler: the gap is larger than the labs admit. Dr. Karim Ahmed argues for a Bengali-first pretraining paradigm.

body: We release BengaliQA alongside our ACL 2025 paper. Here we discuss what makes QA in Bengali hard — entity ambiguity, cultural knowledge, and the absence of a Standard Simplified Bengali norm.
